item.title: Ticket #1042 (get_links() doesn't respect before, between and after link text) closed
item.dc:creator: ryan

item.title: Ticket #1042 (get_links() doesn't respect before, between and after link text) updated
item.dc:creator: Kings
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1042 (get_links() doesn't respect before, between and after link text) created
item.dc:creator: Kings
item.description:
The get_links() function has the before, between and after link text hard-coded in, despite the fact that you can change it in the Links Manager.

The fix is really easy, and I've already fixed it on my own WP install. I'm a bit suprised this isn't fixed yet but I did check the trunk, and it's still hard-coded in.

I've attached a file with the instructions to fix it.

item.title: Ticket #1041 (Pingback texts (Suggestion)) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1041 (Pingback texts (Suggestion)) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
WP currently chops pingback texts in a somewhat ugly manner.

It would be nice if, rather than taking a more or less random part of the text around the link, WP would take the sentence in which the link appears. And maybe perhaps the sentence immediately before and after in the paragraph (if any), to better put the link in context.

-- denis _\@/_ semiologic.com

item.title: Ticket #1012 (Rss2 feed) updated
item.dc:creator: kdotcom
item.description:
Still no solution from feedburner working for me.

I have tried: changing (false === strpos($_SERVERPATH_INFO?, 'index.php')) to (false === strpos($_SERVERPATH_INFO?, '.php'))

I have tried commenting out: /* if ( preg_match('/cgi/', php_sapi_name()) )

@header('Status: 404 Not Found');

else

@header('HTTP/1.x 404 Not Found'); */

Nothing is working. The RSS feed is legit, confirmed everywhere, but feedburner is not getting it to work because of something. Thoughts?

item.title: Ticket #1012 (Rss2 feed) updated
item.dc:creator: kdotcom
item.description:
Turns out it is a GoDaddy (our host) related issue... Anyone have a fix?

Sometimes our feeds work and sometimes they don't - its very strange!

item.title: Ticket #1039 (Wrong label allignment in users profile editing) created

item.title: Ticket #1023 (get_links() ignores $echo setting) updated
item.dc:creator: tivac
item.description:
I took a look at it and programmed in a simple fix that buffers the output to a variable called $output. At the end of the script it does an if() check against the value of $echo. If true $output is echoed, false causes it to be returned.

EDIT: I totally spaced and that first patch has two echo statements that were not replaced. I'm uploading a new patch and lashing myself severely for not being more careful about checking.

edited on: 03-06-05 09:30

item.title: Ticket #1038 (Limit access to php files) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1038 (Limit access to php files) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Please provide htaccess files or a sample apache configuration for limiting access to php files. E.g. nobody ever should need to open wp-includes/*php directly.

Access can be limited with the <Files> and <FilesMatch> directives.

item.title: Ticket #1037 (Add SSL support for admin operations) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1037 (Add SSL support for admin operations) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: It would be nice to have client and admin stuff separated, so that all stuff that needs passwords/cookies can be routed over SSL while all client stuff (reading, posting comments) still can go entirely over unencrypted connections.

item.title: Ticket #994 (Installation files not internazionalized) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: That string cannot be translated because wp-config.php must be loaded before we can make gettext calls. Since the error occurs in the event that wp-config.php cannot be loaded, gettext is not available.

item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1034 (WP adds irrelevant 'next page') created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
e.g. ​http://www.semiologic.com/cats/information-technology/

The page should display 50 items, currently has 25 of them, yet it adds a 'next page'. Admin panel says I've 21 items in the category. But then there are subcategories so this is probably not relevant.

I reported this bug once, but it seems it disappeared from the list.

-- denis _\@/_ semiologic.com

item.title: Ticket #1033 (Missing gettext entries) updated
item.dc:creator: sakis
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1033 (Missing gettext entries) created
item.dc:creator: sakis
item.description:
1. In Manage - Files: the word 'Other Files'
  2. In Link Categories: the 'Y', 'N' and 'rand' values
  3. In plugins: 'Visit author homepage' title tooltip. (In both admin-functions.php and functions.php)
  4. In Dashboard's recent activity box: the word 'on' as is for example in "Administrator on hello world!"

Also under blog stats, title tooltips for article, commens and categories.

  1. The word 'Uncetegorized'

I hope it helps

item.title: Ticket #1032 (Cockneyreplace can't be customised) updated
item.dc:creator: slebog
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1032 (Cockneyreplace can't be customised) created
item.dc:creator: slebog
item.description: It would be useful to allow customisation of the cockneyreplace feature in functions-formatting.php. End-users could then add their own words more easily, and localisers could provide lists relevant to their language.

item.title: Ticket #1031 (Problem displaying output of a page when its slug is equal to the slug ...) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Oops, my bad: it's not both posts that are outputted but rather only one of the two is outputted for both. That's what I get for filing a bug too quickly, I guess.

Also, a clarification: when I said "'top' is undefined", I meant that the specific number and type of pages there was something I hadn't tested, so I don't know how the value of 'top' affects whether the error happens or not.

item.title: Ticket #1031 (Problem displaying output of a page when its slug is equal to the slug ...) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1031 (Problem displaying output of a page when its slug is equal to the slug ...) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: If you have two pages with the same slug (for example, /quux/foo/baz/ and /quux/bar/baz/), the contents of both pages are outputted when viewing either page.
